column4: hey guys, quick question what exactly does the command "sudo apt-get update" do? how come when i use this i get updates sometimes
it updates package information for available packages
boot into normal mode, login at console, install your package
why do you use recovery mode with all its limitations for this?
console-login not X
boot, pres alt-ctrl-f1, login
boot, pres alt-ctrl-f1, login
it just beeps nothing happens
press "ALT-CTRL-F2"
then you have way more problems than just a removed package
nmcli con   it should show you your connections. take the connection name of your wifi-connection and "nmcli con id "that_name" up"
ballhome is given under NAME when you run "nmcli con"?
nmcli con id "ballhome" up
err*           nmcli con up id "ballhome"
nmcli -p dev
does it show wlan0?
nmcli nm wifi on
try again:  nmcli con up id ballhome              <- make sure to spell ballhome exact as given from "nmcli con"
sudo rfkill unblock all
rfkill list wifi  does it show hard- or soft-blocked for your wifi?
does your laptop have any key-combos/switches to en-/disable wifi?
try again:  nmcli con up id ballhome              again
